org.jlab.mya.stream

Class EventStream<T extends Event>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.mya.stream.EventStream<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Event type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Channel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListStream, WrappedStream

    public abstract class EventStream<T extends Event>
extends Object
implements Channel
    Provides an I/O Channel for streaming Mya events. Since Mya data is often very large it is generally a good idea to stream Mya data instead of accumulate it in memory. Therefore the fundamental behavior of this API is to stream data. You can easily accumulate the data into a collection if you believe the JVM has memory to hold it. Check the count of rows before doing that. A channel remains open until closed so generally you'll want to use a try-with-resources approach to using this class or it's subclasses. Be advised that generally an open EventStream holds database resources open and should be closed as quickly as possible (generally the first stream in a set of possibly nested streams is a DatabaseSourceStream, which holds a database connection). This class is abstract and concrete implementations provide Mya event type specific streams.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public abstract T read()
                throws ClosedChannelException,
                       IOException
        Read the next event from the stream. Generally you'll want to iterate over the stream using a while loop.
        Returns:
        The next event or null if End-Of-Stream reached
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException - If the channel is closed
        IOException - If unable to read the next event

      • getType

        public Class<T> getType()
        Obtain type of stream.

        In Java, Generics are erased at runtime so if you want to know what type something is you must pass it as an argument. That's why type info is specified twice in EventStream: once for the compiler and once for the runtime. All so you can call the method getType() at runtime!

        Returns:
        The type
